problems.title: Partition to K Equal Sum Subsets (Bit Manipulation)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given an integer array nums and an integer k, return true if it is possible to divide this array into k non-empty subsets whose sums are all equal.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
4 3 2 3 5 2 1
4

Sample Output
True

Explanation: It is possible to divide it into 4 subsets (5), (1, 4), (2,3), (2,3) with equal sums.

Sample Input
1 2 3 4
3

Sample Output
False

Explanation: It is not possible to divide the array into 3 equal sum subsets.
problems.constraints:
1 <= k <= nums.length <= 16
1 <= nums[i] <= 10^4
The frequency of each element is in the range [1, 4].

starterCodes.code:
class Solution:
    def canPartitionKSubsets(self, nums, k):

        pass

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    lines = sys.stdin.read().strip().split('\n')
    nums = list(map(int, lines[0].split()))
    k = int(lines[1]) if len(lines) > 1 else 0
    sol = Solution()
    result = sol.canPartitionKSubsets(nums, k)
    print("True" if result else "False")

hintsList: Calculate target sum = total_sum / k. Use backtracking with bit manipulation to track which elements are used.
Try to fill each subset one by one, ensuring each subset sums to target.
